sentences.en: Cavalry, raising clouds of choking dust, went past endlessly.
sentences.cn: 骑兵一路上不断扬起令人窒息的灰尘.

sentences.en: Everyone I knew was either in the cavalry or the infantry.
sentences.cn: 我认识的人要么在骑兵队,要么是步兵.

sentences.en: He was arguing with the King about the need to maintain the cavalry at full strength.
sentences.cn: 他正和国王讨论保留骑兵全部力量的必要性。

sentences.en: I was assigned to Troop A of the 10th Cavalry.
sentences.cn: 我被派往第10骑兵队的A连。

sentences.en: In a modern army, cavalry regiments use armoured vehicles and ride horses only on special public occasions.
sentences.cn: 在现代化的军队中, 骑兵团使用装甲车,只有在特殊的公共节庆场合才骑马.

sentences.en: Large crowds stood in the space between the Persian cavalry.
sentences.cn: 大批群众挤满了波斯骑兵中间的空隙.

sentences.en: The Black Prince led a cavalry charge against them.
sentences.cn: 黑王子带领骑兵向他们冲去。

sentences.en: The cavalry charged down on the defenceless villagers.
sentences.cn: 骑兵向手无寸铁的村民们冲了过去.

sentences.en: The cavalry charged to the front.
The cavalry rode off at a dash.
sentences.cn: 骑兵队整齐地奔驰而去.

sentences.en: The cavalry scattered them and chased them off the field.
sentences.cn: 骑兵驱散了他们并把他们逐出了战场。

sentences.en: The enemy cavalry rode our men down.
sentences.cn: 敌人的骑兵撞倒了我们的人.

sentences.en: They've probably bombed hell out of their own cavalry.
sentences.cn: 他们或许把自己的骑兵炸得灵魂出窍.

sentences.en: Two regiments of cavalry were called out to tame the crowds.
sentences.cn: 调集了两个装甲兵团去威慑、控制人群。

sentences.en: We were taken in flank by a troop of cavalry.
sentences.cn: 我们翼侧受到一队骑兵的袭击.

trans.tran_cn: 骑兵（队），骑兵部队，装甲部队，骑者
trans.tran_en: the part of an army that fights on horses, especially in the past
